chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Sigma: PropositionalVariables
eqb: Var -> Var -> bool

Goal:
(forall p q : Var, eqb p q = true <-> p = q) -> forall x y : expr Sigma, expr_eqb eqb x y = true <-> x = y

Premises:
expr_eqb = fun (Sigma : PropositionalVariables) (eqb : Var -> Var -> bool) => fix expr_eqb (x1 x2 : expr Sigma) {struct x1} : bool := match x1 with | andp y1 z1 => match x2 with | andp y2 z2 => (expr_eqb y1 y2 && expr_eqb z1 z2)%bool | _ => false end | orp y1 z1 => match x2 with | orp y2 z2 => (expr_eqb y1 y2 && expr_eqb z1 z2)%bool | _ => false end | impp y1 z1 => match x2 with | impp y2 z2 => (expr_eqb y1 y2 && expr_eqb z1 z2)%bool | _ => false end | sepcon y1 z1 => match x2 with | sepcon y2 z2 => (expr_eq
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Inductive expr (Sigma : PropositionalVariables) : Type := andp : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | orp : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | impp : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | sepcon : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | wand : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | emp : expr Sigma | falsep : expr Sigma | varp : Var -> expr Sigma For andp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For orp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For impp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For sepcon: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For wand: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For emp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For falsep: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For varp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted
Var = fun PropositionalVariables0 : PropositionalVariables => let (Var) := PropositionalVariables0 in Var : PropositionalVariables -> Type Argument PropositionalVariables is implicit and maximally inserted
Fin.eq_dec : forall x y : Fin.t ?n, {x = y} + {x <> y} where ?n : [Sigma : PropositionalVariables eqb : Var -> Var -> bool |- nat]
Nat.lcm_unique_alt : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> (forall q : nat, Nat.divide p q <-> Nat.divide n q /\ Nat.divide m q) -> Nat.lcm n m = p
Tauto.eval_f_morph : forall (ex : ?TX -> Prop) (ev ev' : ?TA -> Prop) (f : Tauto.GFormula), (forall a : ?TA, ev a <-> ev' a) -> Tauto.eval_f ex ev f < -> Tauto.eval_f ex ev' f where ?TA : [Sigma : PropositionalVariables eqb : Var -> Var -> bool |- Type] ?TX : [Sigma : PropositionalVariables eqb : Var -> Var -> bool |- Type] ?AA : [Sigma : PropositionalVariables eqb : Var -> Var -> bool |- Type] ?AF : [Sigma : PropositionalVariables eqb : Var -> Var -> bool |- Type]
Nat.lcm_unique : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> Nat.divide n p -> Nat.divide m p -> (forall q : nat, Nat.divide n q -> Nat.divide m q -> Nat.divide p q) -> Nat.lcm n m = p
Nat.gcd_unique_alt : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> (forall q : nat, Nat.divide q p <-> Nat.divide q n /\ Nat.divide q m) -> Nat.gcd n m = p
Nat.gcd_unique_alt' : forall n m p : nat, (forall q : nat, Nat.divide q p <-> Nat.divide q n /\ Nat.divide q m) -> Nat.gcd n m = p
Fin.eqb_eq : forall (n : nat) (p q : Fin.t n), Fin.eqb p q = true < -> p = q
Tauto.GFormula_ind : forall P : Tauto.GFormula -> Prop, P Tauto.TT -> P Tauto.FF -> (forall t : ?TX, P (Tauto.X t)) -> (forall (t : ?TA) (a : ?AA), P (Tauto.A t a)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.Cj g g0)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.D g g0)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> P (Tauto.N g)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall (o : option ?AF) (g0 : Tauto.GFormula), P g0 -> P (Tauto.I g o g0)) ->...-> bool |- Type]
VectorEq.eqb_eq : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = true <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : VectorDef.t A n), VectorEq.eqb A A_beq v1 v2 = true < -> v1 = v2
Nat.gcd_unique : forall n m p : nat, 0 <= p -> Nat.divide p n -> Nat.divide p m -> (forall q : nat, Nat.divide q n -> Nat.divide q m -> Nat.divide q p) -> Nat.gcd n m = p
Zle_bool_plus_mono : forall n m p q : Z, (n <=? m)%Z = true -> (p <=? q)%Z = true -> (n + p <=? m + q)%Z = true
VectorEq.eq_dec : forall (A : Type) (A_beq : A -> A -> bool), (forall x y : A, A_beq x y = true <-> x = y) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 v2 : VectorDef.t A n), {v1 = v2} + {v1 <> v2}

Z.lcm_unique_alt : forall n m p : Z, (0 <= p)%Z -> (forall q : Z, (p | q)%Z <-> (n | q)%Z /\ (m | q)%Z) -> Z.lcm n m = p
N.lcm_unique_alt : forall n m p : N, (0 <= p)%N -> (forall q : N, (p | q)%N <-> (n | q)%N /\ (m | q)%N) -> N.lcm n m = p
N.gcd_unique_alt : forall n m p : N, (0 <= p)%N -> (forall q : N, (q | p)%N <-> (q | n)%N /\ (q | m)%N) -> N.gcd n m = p
Z.gcd_unique_alt : forall n m p : Z, (0 <= p)%Z -> (forall q : Z, (q | p)%Z <-> (q | n)%Z /\ (q | m)%Z) -> Z.gcd n m = p
N.gcd_unique_alt' : forall n m p : N, (forall q : N, (q | p)%N <-> (q | n)%N /\ (q | m)%N) -> N.gcd n m = p

expr_rect : forall (Sigma : PropositionalVariables) (P : expr Sigma -> Type), (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (andp e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (orp e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (impp e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (sepcon e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (wand e e0)) -> P emp -> P falsep -> (forall v : Var, P (varp v)) -> forall e : expr Sigma, P e
VectorDef.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> Type, P 0 (VectorDef.nil ?A) (VectorDef.nil ?B) -> (forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 -> forall (a : ?A) (b : ?B), P (S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a n v1) (VectorDef.cons ?B b n v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 where ?A : [Sigma : PropositionalVariables eqb : Var -> Var -> bool |- Type] ?B : [Sigma : PropositionalVariables eqb : Var -> Var -> bool |- Type]
QArith_base.Qeq = fun p q : QArith_base.Q => (QArith_base.Qnum p * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden q))%Z = (QArith_base.Qnum q * Z.pos (QArith_base.Qden p))%Z : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> Prop Argument scopes are [Q_scope Q_scope]

QArith_base.Qeq_bool_iff : forall x y : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qeq_bool x y = true < -> QArith_base.Qeq x y
ZMicromega.Vars.Facts.add_mem_3 : forall (s : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) (x y : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt), FSetPositive.PositiveSet.mem y s = true -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.mem y (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.add x s) = true
N.divide = fun p q : N => exists r : N, q = (r * p)%N : N -> N -> Prop Argument scopes are [N_scope N_scope]
Z.lcm_unique : forall n m p : Z, (0 <= p)%Z -> (n | p)%Z -> (m | p)%Z -> (forall q : Z, (n | q)%Z -> (m | q)%Z -> (p | q)%Z) -> Z.lcm n m = p
N.lcm_unique : forall n m p : N, (0 <= p)%N -> (n | p)%N -> (m | p)%N -> (forall q : N, (n | q)%N -> (m | q)%N -> (p | q)%N) -> N.lcm n m = p
N.gcd_unique : forall n m p : N, (0 <= p)%N -> (p | n)%N -> (p | m)%N -> (forall q : N, (q | n)%N -> (q | m)%N -> (q | p)%N) -> N.gcd n m = p

```coq
intros Sigma eqb.
induction (expr_eqb Sigma eqb) as [|x1 x2 IHx] using expr_ind.
- simpl. intros. reflexivity.
- intros. rewrite <- IHx. auto.
Qed.```

original: intros Sigma eqb. induction (expr_eqb Sigma eqb) as [|x1 x2 IHx] using expr_ind. - simpl. intros. reflexivity. - intros. rewrite <- IHx. auto.
